column5: hd box and I believe its set to 1080  Honestly and not being a technophile the picute quality is pretty good.....Im sure there are ways to tweak it to the 10th degree...but @ 40 with 3 growing kids rather fish then sit and watch the tube..........of course unless shelly and Cortney are on
Pioneer plasma combined with Starchoice HD gets my vote

No worries on the HI JACK,N fellas,been there and done that,LOL We went with RCA. Not a bad choice for a nice comfortable screen. Now if we could just get the frigg,n DVD to work. HAHAHAHA.12 months free from Rogers for hi dumb ass.  Now I am in the market for a better camera. Go Dale Go Man what a difference in watchin the race.    Thanks for all the input.
I would go with Samsung...great product...aslo LG has a 50" for $1499.  But there are much better tv's
I have the Samsung 52"lcd......love the thing

Sony, got 3 of them all different sizes and one Sharp. Bought Sony for 40 years and never had a problem. Stereo and radio also Sony. I think they are all pretty good today though, some parts are made by one company for most TV's these days anyway.

I was out TV shopping the other day and was BLOWN AWAY by the Samsung LCD...no motion blur and an amazing picture. It had a much better pic than the others that cost way more. I beleive there is a law in the US that ALL TV stations must go digital/HD by the end of this year. And yes, Bell sucks monkey butts. Get Cogeco if you can.
Do you have the "HD" box from Rogers? Cable is Way worse the Sat for quality of HD.... also what setting do you have your TV @ while watching a HD channel? 480i/p 760i/p 1080i/p??  G
